ResourceHeader.ResourceName: GOES 15 Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detector (EPEAD) proton fluxes data at 8 s Resolution in Spacecraft Coordinates
ResourceHeader.Description: The GOES 15 Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detectors (EPEAD) are essentially the same as the Energetic Particle Sensor (EPS) on GOES 8-12. There are two EPEADs on each satellite, one looking east and one looking west. For more information, please see T. G. Onsager et al. (1996), Operational uses of the GOES energetic particle detectors, in GOES-8 and Beyond, Proc. SPIE, Vol. 2812, edited by E. R. Washwell, pp. 281-290, Bellingham, WA. These data file contain mainly information on the proton fluxes with energies from .74-4.2 MeV from both the A and B detectors. Data files contain long descriptive header.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: NASA-Office of Space Science Applications (United States); NOAA National Environmental Satellite Service (United States); Dr. Terry G. Onsager

InformationURL.Name: GOES N, O, and P Brochure
InformationURL.Description: Information about the magnetometers onboard GOES 15.

AccessURL.Name: Direct access to the GOES 15 Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detectors data
AccessURL.Description: Direct link to the GOES 15 Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detectors data in CSV format as well as the energetic particle data from other GOES spacecraft. The data are sorted by year, month, spacecraft, and file type. The file names indicates the data type, spacecraft number, year, month, and resolution. For example, g15_epead_e2ew_16s_20080301_20080301.csv, indicates goes 15 magnetometer data at 16 s resolution from start of March 1, 2008 to the end of March 1, 2008.

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: NASA; NOAA; Dr. Terry G. Onsager

TimeSpan.Note: Data file may fill out the first month and last month with flags. Time format in data files is year-month-day hour:minute:seconds.

NumericalData.Keyword: Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detectors

Parameter.Name: Seconds of the Month
Parameter.Description: Time format in data files is year-month-day hour:minute:seconds.

Parameter.Name: Quality flag for protons with energies from .74-4.2 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Quality flag non-zero value indicates data quality issue.

Parameter.Name: Count rate of protons with energies from .74-4.2 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average number of counts per second of protons with energies from .74-4.2 MeV from the B detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite.

Parameter.Name: Average flux of protons with energies from .74-4.2 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average flux of 2.5 MeV protons from the B detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite with no correction applied to remove electron contamination.

Parameter.Name: Quality flag for protons with energies from .74-4.2 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Quality flag non-zero value indicates data quality issue.

Parameter.Name: Count rate of protons with energies from .74-4.2 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average number of counts per second of protons with energies from .74-4.2 MeV from the A detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite.

Parameter.Name: Average flux of protons with energies from .74-4.2 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average flux of 2.5 MeV protons from the A detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite with no correction applied to remove electron contamination.
